column4: I'm using a single partition for the /home directory on two different ubuntu installations. both have the same username. when I boot into the second (most recently installed) installation it tells me that that /home partition has an error but if I ignore it I can boot into the system and it works perfectly as far as I can tell. any ideas as to the error's origin?
Have you run fsck on the partition?
not aside from the fsck performed at boot
No problems while actually running?
nope. I'm on it right now
Very odd
yeah. I was thinking it might have something to do with UIDs or something. I don't know anything about that though
It's possible.  Have you checked whether they are different?
I haven't. I'm not sure how, to be honest
System > Admin > Users is your easiest bet.  Under the advanced tab of properties
hm... yeah. I just checked the /etc/passwd on both installations and the entries for the corresponding users are identical
Does it say anything other than "there is an error"?  Anything useful in log files?
no for the first question, and I wouldn't know which log files to check to answer the second
I usually just pop into /var/log/ and look at anything that looks interesting.  Particularly syslog and the kernel one.
oh. haha good plan. I'll check that out, yeah
nothin good in the logs
Darn.  Anything odd about this partition setup?  When did this start?
it started just when I installed in an hour ago. I've got edgy on /dev/sda1, the home on /dev/sda2, windows on /dev/sdb1, and this one (dapper) on /dev/sdb2
this one was the one I just installed because the dist-upgrades from breezy --> dapper --> edgy kind of messed up my system
maybe it's getting weirded out b/c they're different disks, not just partitions?
yeah. it's probably something like that. I think I'm gonna give it a topic on the message boards
good plan
thanks for the help. I'll be off now
